| Freedom of Association and Protection of the Right to Organize image_width =

The 'Freedom of Association and Protection of the Right to Organise Convention'
(1948) [http://www.ilo.org/dyn/normlex/en/f?p=NORMLEXPUB:12100:0::NO:12100:P121-
00_INSTRUMENT_ID:312232:NO No 87] is an International Labour Organization
Convention, and one of eight conventions that form the core of international
labour law, as interpreted by the Declaration on Fundamental Principles and
Rights at Work.
